events.name: Miniature Clay Making Workshop - CHIJ Our Lady of Nativity
events.description:
Hawker culture in Singapore @ SGEatWithUs 
(CHIJ Our Lady of the Nativity and St Gabriel’s Secondary School) 
  
Students from CHIJ Our Lady of the Nativity and St Gabriel’s Secondary School will be presenting an exhibition on Singapore hawker culture in conjunction with an SGEatWithUs event at the National Library Board Plaza. Visitors to the exhibition will be able to learn more about the past, present and the future of Singapore’s hawker culture, based on research that the S6 Cluster Schools have done. 
  
In addition, students from St Gabriels’ Secondary School will be sharing the findings of a smaller-scale study that they have conducted on the history and development of the Serangoon Gardens Hawker Centre. The students will present their findings from oral history interviews with the residents and hawkers of Serangoon Gardens, as well as archival research. 
  
The students of CHIJ Our Lady of the Nativity will be showcasing their projects around the theme “Every Dish Tells a Story”.  Visitors can also look forward to a hands-on activity, conducted by the teachers and students of CHIJ Our Lady of the Nativity, to create clay miniatures of their favourite hawker dishes. Through this combined exhibition as a whole, the students aim to inspire  an appreciation of how hawker culture in Singapore is an invaluable asset to our national heritage and identity. 
  
To secure a slot to create the miniature hawker dishes, please register for this event
events.location: The Plaza in National Library, , 100 Victoria St, Singapore 188064
